title: Hochul Visits Cornell to Reassure Jewish Students Rattled by Online Threats
description: “I want them to know they are not alone,” New York’s governor said of the students, after posts on a student forum called for violence against Jews.

title: Famed Iranian Rights Lawyer Reportedly Jailed and Beaten
description: Nasrin Sotoudeh was one of several activists arrested at the funeral of Armita Geravand, a 16-year-old girl who reportedly died at the hands of Iran’s hijab enforcers.

title: Israel announces the first rescue of a soldier abducted on Oct. 7, a 19-year-old woman.
description: She was abducted after Hamas gunmen overran and briefly captured a military base in Nahal Oz, just east of the northern Gaza Strip.

title: Israel announces the first rescue of a soldier abducted on Oct. 7, a 19-year-old woman.
description: She was abducted after Hamas gunmen overran and briefly captured a military base in Nahal Oz, just east of the northern Gaza Strip.

title: ‘Friends’ Cast Release Statement on Matthew Perry’s Death
description: Perry, who portrayed Chandler Bing, died on Saturday. He was 54.

title: Bloomberg and 34,000 Donors Combine to Give $88 Million to Israel Medical Service
description: The former New York City mayor and billionaire philanthropist said he would match $44 million in donations from nearly 34,000 people.

title: Settler Violence Rising Against Palestinians in the West Bank
description: More than 100 Palestinians have been killed, more than 2,000 injured and nearly 1,000 forcibly displaced by Israeli settlers since Hamas’s Oct. 7 attacks on Israel, the United Nations said.

title: Gazans, as Bombs Fall, Say Escape Is Impossible
description: As bombs fell in the background, Palestinians in the Hamas-ruled territory recounted a struggle to survive.

title: Netanyahu Rejects Calls for a Cease-fire Against Hamas in Gaza
description: Israel’s prime minister adopted a defiant tone in a rare news briefing, saying that the country would not agree to a halt in attacks because, he argued, doing so would strengthen Hamas.

title: Democratic Rifts Over Israel Burst to the Forefront in Congress
description: The divisions are erupting as the House weighs a G.O.P. bid to censure the only Palestinian-American member of Congress for criticizing Israel and votes on a large aid bill to back Israel in the war in Gaza.

title: Biden’s Support for Israel Now Comes With Words of Caution
description: The administration has become more critical of Israel’s response to the Hamas attacks, a shift that U.S. officials attribute to the humanitarian crisis in Gaza.

title: Tuesday Briefing: Israeli Forces Advance on Gaza City
description: Plus we remember Matthew Perry.

title: Israelis Advance on Gaza City, as Netanyahu Rejects Cease-Fire
description: Israel’s leaders vowed to destroy Hamas, which controls the Gaza Strip, after the deadly Oct. 7 attack, and Israeli ground forces are closing in on the city from three directions.

title: Israel Shrouds Gaza Invasion in Secrecy
description: After an air campaign that killed thousands of Palestinians, Israel has begun a ground assault, but it took hours for outside observers to understand what was happening. The ambiguity was intentional.

title: Wanda Poltawska, 101, Who Forged a Friendship With a Future Pope, Dies
description: She survived gruesome medical experimentation at the Ravensbrück concentration camp to become a psychiatrist — counseled by the priest who would become John Paul II.

title: ‘A Very Slow Game:’ Why the Pace of Israel’s Ground Operation Counts
description: Israel’s invasion of Gaza is proceeding more slowly than expected. That may suit the needs of its allies — and its adversaries, analysts say.

title: Shani Louk, believed kidnapped on Oct. 7, was likely already dead when she was taken into Gaza, family says.
description: Shortly after the Oct. 7 attacks, Hamas released a video showing a woman lying face down and mostly naked in the back of a pickup truck. Ms. Louk’s mother said the woman was likely her daughter.

title: A Leaning Tower in Italy (Not Pisa) Becomes a Worry
description: City officials in Bologna have closed a city-center square as they study what to do about the Garisenda Tower. A solution could take years.

title: Near an Acapulco Beach: Food, Water and Prayer After Hurricane Otis
description: Dozens of displaced locals gathered in a converted shelter, waiting for resources to be delivered to their ravaged city.

title: Energy Dept. Pours Billions Into Electric Grids
description: America’s electric grids may need to expand by two-thirds by 2035 to handle future growth in clean energy, the agency said. The nation isn’t on track.

title: Carbon Emissions Budget to Hit Paris Accord Goals Is Now Smaller
description: Limiting warming to 1.5 degrees Celsius would be harder than ever, new calculations show, but less ambitious targets are still in reach.

title: Israel-Hamas War: Israel Says It Struck Hundreds of Targets in Gaza Over the Weekend
description: President Biden called on Israel to protect civilians as it expanded ground operations in Gaza.

title: Middle East War Could Cause Oil Price Shock, World Bank Warns
description: A new report outlined how a major escalation of the conflict between Israel and Hamas could fuel a new bout of inflation.

title: Dozens Arrested in Dagestan After Mob Storms Plane Arriving From Israel
description: The authorities in the southern Russia republic said that the rioting had been calmed and vowed to prevent further clashes. At least 20 people, including police officers were injured.

title: Both Sides Pay a Bloody Price for Coveted Ukrainian City
description: The fight for the battered city of Avdiivka has emerged this fall as the fiercest battle of the war. Waves of Russian assaults have not broken through so far.

title: Afghans Leaving Pakistan Ahead of Ultimatum
description: More than 70,000 undocumented Afghans have returned home in recent weeks to meet a Wednesday deadline ordered by the Pakistani government.

title: Monday Briefing
description: Israel is ‘expanding’ ground operations in Gaza.

title: Cornell Jewish Center Under Guard After Online Threats to Jewish Students
description: “We will not tolerate antisemitism at Cornell,” the university president said after threats were made against the Center for Jewish Living.

title: War Through the Eyes of Gaza’s Children
description: At a U.N. camp in southern Gaza, children have been forced to flee their homes and live in squalid conditions while trying to make sense of a war with no end in sight.
